enWisdom: Affection is an auspicious blessing
Friendship is affinity
Friendship is the closest relationship
Friendship is the closest kinship
A friend is the closest of relations
Brothers are the best of assets [in times of hardship]
Being friendly with people is the cornerstone of intelligence
A believer is affectionate, endearing and compassionate
Friendship is one of two [close] relationships
The best of your brothers is the one whose anger at you increases in matters pertaining to the truth
A friend is the better of the two resources
A friend is a better asset and is more lasting in fondness

Wisdom: الرَّفِيقُ فِي دُنْيَاهُ كَالرَّفِيقِ فِي دِينِهِ
enWisdom: Whoever invites you to the Eternal Abode and assists you to work for it, then he is the true, caring friend

Wisdom: الْمُفْلِحُ مَنْ نَهَضَ بِجَنَاحٍ أَوِ [و] اسْتَسْلَمَ فَاسْتَرَاحَ
enWisdom: The successful one is he who [either] spreads his wings or remains peaceful and enjoys ease
The beginning of intelligence is being friendly [with the people]
The most beneficial of treasures is the love of the hearts
The closest proximity is the affection of the hearts
The farthest remoteness is the aloofness of the hearts

Wisdom: أَفْضَلُ النَّاسِ مِنَّةً مَنْ بَدَأَ بِالْمَوَدَّةِ
enWisdom: The best person in granting favours is the one who begins by [showing] friendship

Wisdom: أَبْعَدُ النَّاسِ سَفَراً مَنْ كَانَ سَفَرُهُ فِي ابْتِغَاءِ أَخٍ صَالِحٍ
enWisdom: The brother whose friendship is strongest is one who is most supportive of his brother [both] in times of ease and difficulty

Wisdom: أَشْرَفُ الشِّيَمِ رِعَايَةُ الْوُدِّ وَأَحْسَنُ الْهِمَمِ إِنْجَازُ الْوَعْدِ
enWisdom: The best habits are honouring one’s companion and assisting one who seeks help

Wisdom: إِنَّ طِبَاعَكَ تَدْعُوكَ إِلَى مَا أَلِفْتَهُ
enWisdom: Verily your natural disposition invites you towards that which you are familiar with

Wisdom: إِنَّ الْمَوَدَّةَ يُعَبِّرُ عَنْهَا اللِّسَانُ وَعَنِ الْمَحَبَّةِ الْعَيْنَانِ
enWisdom: Verily friendship is expressed by the tongue whereas love is expressed by the gaze (or the eyes)

Wisdom: خَلِيلُ الْمَرْءِ دَلِيلٌ عَلَى عَقْلِهِ وَكَلَامُهُ بُرْهَانُ فَضْلِهِ
enWisdom: A man’s friend is a sign of his intelligence and his speech is evidence of his merit

Wisdom: دَارِ عَدُوَّكَ وَأَخْلِصْ لِوَدُودِكَ تَحْفَظِ الْأُخُوَّةَ وَتُحْرِزِ [الْمُرُوَّةَ] الْمَوَدَّةَ
enWisdom: Be courteous to your enemy and be sincere with your close friend, [by this] you will protect [your] brotherhood and safeguard [your] magnanimity
The cornerstone of intelligence is being friendly with the people
Inquire about the companion [on the journey] before the route

Wisdom: سَلُوا الْقُلُوبَ [الْقَلْبَ‏] عَنِ الْمَوَدَّاتِ فَإِنَّهَا شَوَاهِدُ لَا تَقْبَلُ الرُّشَا
enWisdom: Ask the hearts about [your] affections, for indeed they are witnesses that do not accept bribes
The gratitude of your equal is through good brotherhood

Wisdom: كُنْ لِلْوُدِّ [لِلْجُودِ] حَافِظاً وَإِنْ لَمْ تَجِدْ مُحَافِظاً
enWisdom: Be an upholder of friendship even if you do not find any custodian [for it]

Wisdom: لَأَنَا أَشَدُّ اغْتِبَاطاً بِمَعْرِفَةِ الْكَرِيمِ مِنْ إِمْسَاكِي عَلَى الْجَوْهَرِ النَّفِيسِ الْغَالِي الثَّمَنِ
enWisdom: Indeed I am happier to [get to] know a noble-minded person than to acquire an expensive and precious jewel

Wisdom: لَيْسَ شَيْ‏ءٌ أَدْعَى لِخَيْرٍ وَأَنْجَى مِنْ شَرٍّ مِنْ صُحْبَةِ الْأَخْيَارِ
enWisdom: There is nothing that brings one closer to good and keeps one safer from evil than keeping company with the righteous
One who reforms [and reconciles with] his opponents attains his goal
One whose wood is soft, his branches become thick

Wisdom: مَنْ لَمْ تَنْفَعْكَ صَدَاقَتُهُ ضَرَّتْكَ عَدَاوَتُهُ
enWisdom: Do not accompany the one who lacks determination

Wisdom: مَنْ وَصَلَكَ وَهُوَ مُعْدِمٌ خَيْرٌ لَكَ مِمَّنْ جَفَاكَ وَهُوَ مُكْثِرٌ
enWisdom: The one who establishes ties with you while he has nothing is better than the one who shuns you while he has plenty

Wisdom: مَا تَأَكَّدَتِ الْحُرْمَةُ بِمِثْلِ الْمُصَاحَبَةِ وَالْمُجَاوَرَةِ
enWisdom: One of the bad choices [that a person can make] is accompanying the wicked

Wisdom: مَا أَقْبَحَ الْقَطِيعَةَ بَعْدَ الصِّلَةِ وَالْجَفَاءَ بَعْدَ الْإِخَاءِ وَالْعَدَاوَةَ بَعْدَ الصَّفَاءِ وَزَوَالَ الْأُلْفَةِ بَعْدَ اسْتِحْكَامِهَا
enWisdom: How ugly is cutting off ties after establishing them, and alienation after brotherhood, and enmity after goodwill, and the disappearance of affinity after it had been strengthened

Wisdom: نِظَامُ الْمُرُوَّةِ حُسْنُ الْأُخُوَّةِ وَنِظَامُ الدِّينِ حُسْنُ الْيَقِينِ
enWisdom: The order of humanity is based on righteous brotherhood and the order of religion is based on unshakable certainty

Wisdom: وَصُولٌ مُعْدِمٌ خَيْرٌ مِنْ جَافٍ مُكْثِرٍ
enWisdom: The ties established [with you] by a pauper is better than the shunning of the affluent
